abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and likewise, satisfactory
            institutional development impacts. This Simplified
            Implementation Completion Report provides the findings and
            implications for subsequent operations, indicating this
            Programmatic Education Sector Adjustment Credit, as the
            first in a series of proposed policy reform credits in the
            education sector, has strong links to the overall
            Development Support Credits of the Bank, and to the Poverty
            Reduction Growth Facility supported by the International
            Monetary Fund (IMF). Notwithstanding, it is however
            realistic to assume that future reform initiatives might
            face resistance: the primary focus of this project was to
            establish institutional arrangements, and policy measures to
            ease governance problems - the focus of future proposed
            operations will be to deepen those reforms. Key among
            reforms will be the establishment of the autonomous NTRCA,
            and increased emphasis on teacher training, continuation of
            the process of privatization of textbook production at the
            secondary level, and potential extension of this process to
            the primary level, continued emphasis on linking financing
            of institutions to performance, and ensuring a significant
            role of communities in school management. For these reforms
            to succeed, it is critical that there is continued political
            commitment of the Government to reforms, of its ownership of
            the results, and of public receptivity of the reform
            initiatives. It is important to note that the first
            programmatic credit was discussed, negotiated and
            implemented at a time when the Government, overcoming its
            initial reservations, increasingly fortified its position to
            carry forward the reform actions. The timing was also
            appropriate, reasonably soon after the elections.
